title: prince andrews ex questions infamous
story: Prince Andrews ex-girlfriend raises questions over photo she claims is fakeLady Victoria Hervey has echoed claims made by the Duke of York on Newsnight, suggesting the infamous photo of him with his arm around Virginia Giuffre is fakePrinc Andrews ex Lady Victoria Hervey has suggested the infamous photo of the Duke of York with Virginia Giuffre was faked Image: PAByChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb Prince Andrew’s former girlfriend Lady Victoria Hervey has questioned whether the picture showing the royal with his arm around his rape accuser Virginia Giuffre may be fake. The former It Girl posted an image on her Instagram page yesterday of Ms Giuffre in what appears to be the same pose and outfit as in the famous picture, but alone on a dferent background. The -year-old socialite, daughter of the th Marquess of Bristol, asked: “Do you believe that photo is real  “Or whatI told you a survivor of [Jeffrey] Epstein’s told me it’s an Irish body double that was edited in.” However, she did not provide any further information to back her claims. During his  Newsnight interview, Prince Andrew told the BBC’s Emily Maitlis he was “at a loss to explain” the famous version of the image. It shows Andrew and Virginia in the London home of Ghislaine Maxwell, who is smiling behind them. Ms Giuffre alleges paedophile Jeffrey Epstein took the picture. She claims she, the Prince, Maxwell and Epstein then went out for dinner and then to a nightclub. On their allegedto the house, she claims that Epstein and Maxwell made her have sex with Andrew. He vigorously denies all the claims.  Paragraph  of her lawsuit states: “The below photograph depicts Prince Andrew, plaintf, and Maxwell at Maxwell’s home prior to Prince Andrew sexually abusing plaintf.” The Duke’s refusal to admit the photograph is genuine is behind a line in his official response to Ms Giuffre’s complaint, filed last week. It reads: “Prince Andrew lacks sufficient information to admit or deny the allegations contained in paragraph  of the complaint.”  Andrew said on Newsnight he could not prove the picture was edited but had reason to believe it was not genuine. He said: “Nobody can prove that photo has been doctored. I don’t believe that photograph has been taken in the way that has been suggested.” US lawyer Rachel Fiset said Prince Andrew’s legal response to the lawsuit indicates that he will “seek an expert’s opinion” on the photo’s authenticity.  Ms Giuffre, , is suing Andrew, , for unspecied damages, which US lawyers said could “easily” be more than £millionshe is successful. The mum of three, an American living in Australia, also alleges she was forced to have sex with the Prince at Epstein’s home in New York and in the US Virgin Islands. title: princess diana wore two watches
story: Why Princess Diana wore two watches on her wrist in lead up to wedding to CharlesPrincess Diana was seen sporting the interesting fashion statement when she went to watch Prince Charles play polo at the Guards Polo Club in Windsor in the lead up to their wedding Image: Rex FeaturesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Feb |commentsPrincess Diana was known for many things, but her style made her the fashion icon of the th century.As time passed, the princessaposs off-duty wardrobe became just as influential as the sleek sht dresses and pearl chokers she wore to royal engagements. And she wasnapost afraid to push boundaries with clothing choices that many royals would have shied away from.Case in point, in pictures from , shortly after Lady Di got engaged to Prince Charles, she was seen wearing a floral blouse and matching skirt - nothing out of the ordinary.But what got people talking was her accessory choice.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. On one hand, she wore a woven metal bracelet, but on the other, she wore two wristwatches. The dainty gold watch was Diana’s, and the other watch, which had a chunky brown leather strap, belonged to Prince Charles. But she didn’t wear two watches to keep track of two dferent time zones, there was a sweet reason for why she doubled up on the accessory. As it turned out, it was a subtle nod to Prince Charles. According to Marie Claire, she put on Charlesapos watch as a tribute to him and to wish him good luck in the match. This kind gesture could be likened to a tradition from the middle ages, where a knight would tie a lady’s handkerchief to the back of his helmet as a good luck talisman.Diana used her clothes and jewellery to pay tribute to loved ones throughout her royal career, a tradition continued by Meghan Markle and the Duchess of Cambridge.Instead of borrowing a tiara from the Queen for her July  wedding, she wore one that her sister had previously worn at her own nuptials. And jewellery also played a heartbreaking role in her le. Just days before Charles and Dianaaposs wedding, the bride-to-be was left devastated when she walked into his private secretary Michael Colborneaposs office to find a package on the desk with Camillaaposs name written on it. Inside she found a gold bracelet engraved with the letters G and F, which stood for Gladys and Fred - the nicknames Charles and Camilla used for each other. Speaking in Channel  documentary, Charles and Di: The Truth Behind their Wedding, biographer Christopher Wilson said: I think she was very suspicious of anything Camilla. She asked to see what was inside and eventually she was allowed to have her way. She was absolutely in tears, in a terrible state about it. It was clear that this was Prince Charlesapos farewell present to Camilla.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: queens thoughtful gift meghan markle
story: Queens thoughtful gt to Meghan Markle ahead of turning point in their relationshipThe Queen invited Meghan Markle on her royal train to Chester as her first royal outing without Prince Harry - and the pair seemed to get on splendidly as they said their hellos to well-wishersMeghan Markle and the Queen Image: Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Feb |comments The Queen gave Meghan Markle the most touching gt to celebrate their first royal outing together after her wedding to Prince Harry. In , the Queen invited Meghan to accompany her on a day of royal engagements in Chester. It was the first time the two women are believed to have spent a large chunk of time together, and they were pictured laughing and joking together.The Monarch also invited Meghan to travel to the city with her on the royal train, an honour usually only reserved for senior titles. The trip would have given the women the opportunity to get to know each other a little better, and hopefully brought them closer together The day out was not only Meghanaposs first engagement with the Queen, it was also her first royal duty without hubby Harry - so itaposs likely she was a bit nervous.So the Queen wanted to mark the day by doing something special for the newest member of her family, and Buckingham Palace revealed the Queen gave Meghan a pair of pearl and diamond drop earrings.Meghan wore the earrings for the day in Chester, and they suited her perfectly.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. The newly named Duchess of Sussex paired the earrings with a bespoke, oat-coloured Givenchy midi dress, which was designed by Clare Waight Keller, who also made her wedding dress. The look was completed with a thin black belt that cinched in the dress, black pointy-toed pumps, and a black clutch. She wore her hair loose and opted for a simple makeup look including black eyeliner, and pink lipstick. Itaposs not confirmed whether the gt was given to Meghan especially for the outing, orthe earrings were a kind aposwelcome to the familyapos gesture. The Queen opted for a bright lime green Stewert Parvin suit for the occasion, which she paired with a Rachel Trevor Morgan hat and a pair of small pearl studs similar to the ones she gted to Meghan. However, the Queen isnapost the only royal known for her memorable gts, and Meghan reportedly impressed with her hilarious but thoughtful Christmas present. Meghan, who was newly engaged to Prince Harry at the time, was tasked with finding the Queen a gt for Christmas.Aware of the rule that royal presents should be cheap and cheeky, Meghan bought something that would not only make her laugh but would delight her dogs too.It was reported that Meghan bought the Queen a singing hamster, which led the monarch to burst out laughing, remarking: It can keep my dogs company.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: royal mail postman can barely
story: Royal Mail postman can barely walk after accidentally eating four hash browniesA postman was filmed saying Im not right as he sat in a chair after accidentally eating hash brownies which Royal Mail had tried to deliver to an empty home, it is claimedThe postie was filmed saying Im not right as he sat down in the office Image: TwitterByKirsty CardReporterMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Feb Royal Mail has launched a probe after a postman who reportedly managed to aposaccidentally eat hash browniesapos was filmed staggering around in the street.Footage shared on social media showed the man barely able to stand up as he walked along a road in Clapham, London, the Daily Star reports. The laced brownies were allegedly stored by staff after they tried to deliver them to an empty home and there was noaddress on the parcel, according to posts on Instagram.It is not clear how the postman came into contact with the treats, which were kept inside a box labelled aposEdibles by Pablochocobarapos. Another man had to come and collect him from his delivery route as he was unable to move his cart, but when he got back to the office he was filmed sitting in a chair saying aposIaposm not right.apos A colleague is heard remarking that the poor postie had munched his way through two of the brownies, before the chap admits he actually had four. Text accompanying the Instagram Stories clip — which was later uploaded to TikTok by a dferent user — explains why the brownies had been eaten: We had a delivery of them with noaddress and the house was empty and they were in our office for a month so we opened them and they got given out. They were eaten between .-.am. The viral video has received over , likes on the app as Londoners found it hilarious that their postman had ended up in such a state. One user said: Crying because this is my postman. Another added: What  What kind of accident is this  Who gave them the brownies  Surely they didnapost just eat anything they found lying around  A third said: How do you accidentally eat hash brownies  Sounds like the best day of work ever. A fourth wrote: I feel for him but I can’t stop laughing and comments ain’t helping. Royal Mail has confirmed that they are aware of the incident and have launched an investigation. A spokesperson told the Daily Star: “Royal Mail expects the highest standards of behaviour from our people at all times. We are taking this matter very seriously. We have commenced an investigation which will determine whether any further action, including disciplinary action, might be taken. We are also reminding all staff at the delivery office of the correct procedures for dealing with items with no address for delivery or .” The delivery service added that they are unaware of any health and wellbeing issues following the incident. title: single mum three doesnt know
story: Single mum-of-three doesnt know how shell cope as energy prices rocketClaire Pulfrey, from Grimsby, currently puts £ a week on gas and £ on electricity with a prepayment plan - she now fears for the future as she is already strugglingClaire Pulfrey from Grimsby, Lincs, with her prepay meter as she worries how she will get by Image: Hull News  PictureByNick WebsterAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsA single mum-of-three doesn’t know how she’ll cope when energy prices rocket in April. Claire Pulfrey, from Grimsby, currently puts £ a week on gas and £ on electricity with a prepayment plan. The former teaching assistant, , recently had her monthly income reduced by £ after her youngest son’s special needs were recently reassessed. With no extra cash left over to treat her three sons, aged seven, nine, and , Claire already scrimps and saves to get through the month. She can no longer afford to take them to the cinema or days out. Now, If she keeps using the same amount of energy, she faces an increase of £. a week. Today, Chancellor Rishi Sunak addressed the nation after the energy regulator Ofgem confirmed the increased price cap will see the average UK household bill increase by nearly £. Speaking in the House of Commons on Thursday he promised that Brits would receive an £ council tax rebate and a £ discount on their energy bill to manage the rising costs.  But Brits slammed Mr Sunak for dressing up the £ loan as a discount, highlighting that it must be paid back in £ instalments over the next five years. On hearing how much more she’ll be paying, Claire said: “Wow, how am I going to work this out to keep up with everything  “I don’t think I can economise more than I do. I’m just going to have to try to cut back on gas and electricityI can. And try to buy less food for me. “I have an electric cooker and gas central heating. I already make sure lights and other things are turned off, I don’t think I can do any more apart from not using any heating or electricity when I’m on my own at home when the kids are at school. “One of my boys has asthma, and I have some health problems. I always put my boys first, soI have to sit in the cold all day then I will, then I can turn on the heating just before I go and pick them up so the house is nice and warm when they come in.  “We’re already really struggling at the moment, but we are just about getting buy. I buy the cheapest foods that will last the longest at the supermarket, but I can’t really give them any treats, even a bar of chocolate. “I’m already on the edge to be honest, I wouldn’t know where to find even an extra £ on food or bills. Already I’m seeing food prices going up, and now this, I really don’t know what I’m going to do.” The confirmed rise in energy bills came just hours before the Bank of England confirmed a . per cent rise in interest rates, and will come into effect at the same time as a  per cent hike in National Insurance tax in April. But the pinch is becoming tighter yet as the UK inflation rate hit a  year high and analysts predict energy bills will rise by another £ in October. title: uk approves fifth covid vaccine
story: UK approves fth Covid vaccine - and it could be used as booster jab for winterThe jab, made by manufacturer Novavax, has been authorised by the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agencyafter safety, quality and effectiveness tests after safety, quality and effectiveness tests" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _FILE-PHOTO-A-woman-holds-a-small-bottle-labeled-with-a-Coronavirus-COVID--Vaccine-sticker-and-a.jpg" width"" "" Novavax has been authorised by the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agencyafter safety, quality and effectiveness tests Image: REUTERSByMartin BagotHealth and Science editorAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Feb  after safety, quality and effectiveness tests" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _FILE-PHOTO-A-woman-holds-a-small-bottle-labeled-with-a-Coronavirus-COVID--Vaccine-sticker-and-a.jpg" data-tracking"facebook|share|top" after safety, quality and effectiveness tests" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _FILE-PHOTO-A-woman-holds-a-small-bottle-labeled-with-a-Coronavirus-COVID--Vaccine-sticker-and-a.jpg" data-tracking"twitter|share|top" after safety, quality and effectiveness tests" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _FILE-PHOTO-A-woman-holds-a-small-bottle-labeled-with-a-Coronavirus-COVID--Vaccine-sticker-and-a.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"|commentsA fth Covid vaccine has been approved by UK regulators and could be used as a booster jab next winter. The jab, made by manufacturer Novavax, has been authorised by the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agencyafter safety, quality and effectiveness tests. Whether it should be offered here and to which patient groups will now be considered by the Joint Committee on Immunisation and Vaccination .Health Secretary Sajid Javid said: “It is great to see our world-renowned medicines regulator approve another Covid- vaccine.“I want the UK to be the best place in the world to conduct clinical trials.  “It’s a testament to the country’s first-rate research and development capabilities for a vaccine with tens of thousands of people taking part in clinical trials here in the UK, contributing to the invaluable research that shows our vaccines are safe and effective.” It follows approval given for Moderna, AstraZeneca, Pfizer and Janssen vaccines, although the latter is not currently available here. Almost , people were involved in clinical trials for the Novavax-made vaccine, called Nuvaxovid.  Prof Sir Munir Pirmohamed, chair of the Commission on Human Medicines, said: “Nuvaxovid is distinct from other Covid- vaccines currently in use in the UK as it uses recombinant protein-based technology which has been used for many years in the development of vaccines to prevent other illnesses, for example, Hepatitis B.” Dr Clive Dix, former Chair of the UK Vaccine Taskforce, said: “This is excellent news as the clinical data on this vaccine is excellent and the strong cellular response should make this an excellent vaccine for boosting next winter. “Not only do we expect a strong durable response but also good stability at fridge temperature so it can be rolled out with the flu vaccine next winter as part of the winter campaign. “This should replace the need to buy more Pfizer and Moderna vaccine and save the UK government a considerable amount of money.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON AstraZeneca plcPfizer Inc.Novavax Inc.The MedicinesFluCoronavirus vaccine" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: uk records 303 new covid
story: UK records  new Covid deaths in  hours after highest rise since last winterThe number of people who have died with Covid has dropped to  today after yesterdays high figure. Data on how many deaths from the virus could soon be scrapped from April onwardsHeres the latest Covid stats for February   Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsThe UK has recorded a further  deaths from Covid and , new infections, Government data shows.The number of deaths recorded in the last  hours is down from  deaths recorded yesterday - the highest amount in  months.Cases remain above ,, , reported on Wednesday. Infection numbers have substantially dropped since peaking around New Year with , infections reported on January . This weekaposs figures show a sharp rise after reinfections in England and Northern Ireland were included for the first time. It means a Covid sufferer who has tested positive at least  days after a previous infection will now be considered a reinfection, according to the UKHSA.  Previously, people were only counted in the data the first time they tested positive for the virus. ONS data suggest the numbers have slightly increased recently because of the virus tearing through primary school aged children. A further , people died from Covid related deaths in the last seven days which also marks a drop – of . per cent. As of  February, ,, Brits have had a first dose of a Covid vaccine while ,, have had a second dose.  A further , people had their booster or third dose of the vaccine bringing the current total to ,,.This comes as Daily Covid stats are reportedly set to be scrapped from April under the Governmentaposs plan to live with the virus. Prime Minister Boris Johnson has already shared plans to drop all remaining coronavirus rules, including the legal requirement to self isolateyou test positive for Covid by March .And a senior Whitehall sources has claimed the daily updates on the number of coronavirus cases, hospitalisations, deaths and other data will be scrapped just weeks later in a report leaked to the i. Free lateral flow tests are not expected to be dropped until July, but those supporting the rumoured move to ditch Covid stats say the Government also need to push for an end to mass testing. title: what your cost living look
story: Cost of living budget calculator - how much your bills will rise by as prices skyrocketMillions of households will experience eye-watering hikes in their energy bills from April  as the price cap is set to increase. The move will affect some  million householdsMillions of people will have more expensive bills from April , says Ofgem Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByAntony Thrower:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments Millions of households will see energy bills increase by almost £ from April, Ofgem has confirmed - and now you can see how much you can expect to pay.The energy price cap - the maximum amount Ofgem says firms can charge customers on iable tarfs - has increased, in part because of the pandemic.As a result, people on default tarfs paying by direct debit will experience an eye-watering % rise, as it jumps from £, to £, from April .Prepayment customers will be worst hit, with an increase of £ from £, to £,.The move will affect some  million households and follows a% rise in October . See how much your bills will be using our Cost of Living Calculator Ofgem chief executive Jonathan Brearley said: We know this rise will be extremely worrying for many people, especially those who are struggling to make ends meet, and Ofgem will ensure energy companies support their customers in any way they can. The energy market has faced a huge challenge due to the unprecedented increase in global gas prices - a once in a -year event - and Ofgemaposs role as energy regulator is to ensure that, under the price cap, energy companies can only charge a fair price based on the true cost of supplying electricity and gas. Ofgem is working to stabilise the market and over the longer term to ersy our sources of energy which will help protect customers from similar price shocks in the future. An announcement on theenergy price caphad been due next week but was brought forward to today.The price cap sets a limit on the rates a supplier can charge for each unit of gas and electricity you use and is reviewed twice a year. Gas prices around the world have climbed, owing to the pandemic. As a result of the prices of wholesale gas - which have quadrupled in the last year - suppliers are now passing on the cost to customers.  Several readers have shared their stories on how the new prices will affect them. Ofgem reviews its energy price cap twice a year. The next time it could change is in October, although this might be altered. While wholesale prices have eased, experts say October could bring another rise in the price cap, possibly to an average £, a year.To ‘take the sting’ out of the announcement, Rishi Sunak announced a one-off repayable £ discount and a rebate on council tax bills.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON OfgemEnergyCouncil taxEnergy billsGas prices" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: bride vows ban dads girlfriend
story: Bride vows to ban dads girlfriend from wedding after seeing dress she plans to wearA bride-to-be has been left infuriated after her dads girlfriend showed her the off-white dress she plans to wear to her wedding, and has vowed to ban hershe doesThe bride is warring with her dads girlfriend over her dress choiceImage: Getty Images WestendByZahna Eklund:,  Feb |comments We all know that one of the cardinal sins of being a guest at a wedding is wearing a dress that could be misconstrued as a wedding dress - and that usually means avoiding all shades of white and cream. But one bride-to-be on Reddit has claimed her dadaposs girlfriend didnapost quite get that memo, as she posted a picture on her Instagram account of the dress she was planning to wear to the womanaposs wedding, which was an off-white silk slip dress that clearly came too close to the white gown the bride had picked out.Sharing her story anonymously on Reddit, the woman said she confronted her dadaposs girlfriend about the dress - but she claimed it was beige, and nothing close to the colour the bride was going to wear. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She said: I just happened to be scrolling on Instagram, where I see my dad’s girlfriend had posted a picture of what she was planning to wear for the wedding. I was livid. It’s literally an off-white silk slip dress and matching blazer. There’s no mistaking the colour since she took it straight from the website itself. I texted my dad immediately as well and asked about the post and questionedit was, in fact, the colour she had posted, since when I went to the website they had it in dferent colours as well. She then got in touch and told me she had taken down the post because aposshe wanted it to be a surprise for my dadapos. And that the colour was supposedly aposbeigeapos, as she put it. I sent a message back to her saying that I am uncomfortable with her wearing a dress so similar in colour to mine and have asked her not to wear it, she has not replied to me.  The bride-to-be then claimed her dadaposs girlfriend had already asked about wearing a dferent dress that was similar to those being worn by her bridal party. She added: What I find kind of ironic is she had previously askedshe could get a dress the same colour as my bridesmaids, and I had asked her to try and avoid that evenpossible. So it baffles me why she would think it’s okay to wear the same colour as the bride. And the bride is so determined not to let the woman wear the off-white dress that sheaposs vowed to have her kicked out of her weddingshe shows up in it. She explained: I’m putting my foot down on this. I’ve already got people saying thatshe shows up in it, they will turn her away on my behalf. I hate being rude and I don’t want to come across as a bridezilla or anything but I think I’m justied in the way I’m feeling. Commenters on the Reddit post were largely on the brideaposs side, as many of them pointed out the general consensus that guests shouldnapost wear white to a wedding. One person said: Everyone knows that you don’t wear white colours close to white to a wedding when you aren’t the bride. As another wrote: Donapost uninvite her, you just need to get a special friend to accidentally spill red wine all over her when she arrives. While a third posted: The only person that should be wearing white at a wedding is the bride. She either chooses a dferent dress or she skips the wedding. That day isn’t about her.Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: i lied family proposal theyre
story: I lied to my family about my proposal - theyre fuming after drunkenly learning truthA man has revealed he lied to his family about proposing to his we and said they are mad and hurt after they discovered the truth via a drunken confessionThe man kept the details of his proposal a secret for five yearsImage: Getty Images Image SourceByZahna Eklund:,  Feb |comments Getting engaged is said to be one of the happiest days of your le - usually falling shortly behind your actual wedding day and the birth of your children. But one man on Reddit has revealed he lied for five years about his own engagement, as he told his family he had proposed to his now-we during a romantic meal a few months after heaposd actually got down on one knee. The reason he lied  Because heaposd actually proposed during his own sisteraposs wedding. Sharing his story anonymously, the man explained his sister had enjoyed a lavish destination wedding five years ago that her husbandaposs parents had paid for and the location was so romantic he decided to pop the question to his girlfriend - and then hide it from his family.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. He said: My sister got married five years ago. Her husbandaposs parents were quite rich and they paid for a destination wedding for five days. They even paid for the flights and the stay for all the immediate family members. Back then, that was hugely romantic and it felt like a fairytale. Although we are doing much better financially now, back then I was sure that I would never be able to do something like that. I didnapost even plan to do this, but I was caught up in the moment and asked my girlfriend to marry me. She said yes but we did not say anything to anyone. I did not want to step on any toes. A few months later, I brought an engagement ring and we told everyone that I had proposed after a romantic meal at home and that was that. However, the cat was let out of the bag five years later when the family went on holiday to the same location, and the manaposs we spilt the beans to his sister while drunk.  He added: A few months ago, we went on a vacation to the same place my sister got married. It was my sister, her husband, her two kids, me, and my we. We were getting drunk and having fun when my we told them that I had proposed to her outside this very restaurant all those years ago. My sister was p***ed and she stormed out. My we feels guilty for letting the cat out of the bag. My brother-in-law also feels that it was cheap of me to use his parentsapos money for a proposal. The man said his sister is now refusing to talk to him - but he thinks she should let it go. He said: Itaposs been weeks and my sister is still cold towards us. I told her it happened years ago and to just let it go. She said that she is hurt, and that was supposed to be her fabulous wedding. She says that the place and time is now memorable to us as the place we agreed to get married and that it will never be remembered as the place she actually got married. She was very mad that I hurt her feelings and now I am just asking her to let it go. Commenters on the Reddit post were largely on the manaposs side, as they said he would have been out of lineheaposd proposed in front of his sisteraposs wedding guests, but doing so discreetly was fine. One said: Normally I’d say youaposre the a**hole, but you didn’t do it publicly in front of everyone. You did it privately. Nobody had hurt feelings until now. While another added: I came in here expecting to say you were in the wrong, but in this case, I think your sister is making too big a deal of this. And a third posted: Your sister is acting immature. Your secret proposal does not in any way affect her marriage or memories. Sheaposs being dramatic and causing hostility for no good reason because no actual harm was done.What do you think  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON RedditProposalsengagedMarriageWeddings" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man hires great employee after
story: Man hires great employee after job interview - but someone  turns up for workA bizarre work dilemma has been shared online, claiming a great new recruit was hired at an IT firm, but on their first day someone totally dferent showed up at the officeThe man was very confusedImage: Getty ImagesByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Feb |commentsWhen it comes to job interviews, people will often try and put their best foot forward to make a good impression on the hiring team.But it seems one candidate up for a role went as far as to send a dferent person to the job interview altogether in order to nab the position. This is the claim a woman has made on the site, askamanager.org, sharing a bizarre situation her husband has been facing at work.In the post, the woman explains that sheaposs just an amused bystander and wanted to get a manageraposs opinion. She goes on to say how her husband had been on a hiring committee and helped to select a new candidate for a job and the whole team was really impressed with the person they picked. However, the person that turned up to start work was nothing like he remembered.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.The woman wrote: My husband works in IT and is on the leadership team at a midsized private company. He was part of a  that recently interviewed a number of folks for an open position on his team. They had a few candidates for a first and second round and had one make it to a third final round before an offer. John accepted the offer and started last week! Except … it’s not the John my husband remembers. My husband was confused. She went on to list all the things her husband found odd, including the man having dferent hair and wearing glasses and how John keeps talking about his three kids and we - while at the interview he said he was single. John can’t answer a number of questions that they previously discussed in the interview, things pretty pivotal to the position. Husband describes John as being aloof and pretty timid whereas John was confident and articulate when they interviewed him. He is convinced this is not the person they hired. The post continued to share how the husband had spoken to his boss Holly about the matter - and sheaposd agreed something was fishy. Husband just got off a call with Holly, their HR business partner, and the internal recruiter who sent the offer. They confirmed the right candidate was offered a job and agreed many things were odd. Another oddity revealed on that phone call … John didn’t know who Holly was she had to reintroduce herself and he asked about her role… Holly was on two of three rounds of interviews and they extensively reviewed their org chart and her role. Unclearthey are working out an error by the hiring committee HR or unravelling fraud. Eventually, HR and the legal team gave them the go-ahead to speak to John about the issues that had arisen. However, she claims that before they even got a chance to ask him what was going on, he simply quit the job on the spot and has been unreachable ever since. The husband is leaving the company soon, so heaposs not sure heaposll ever get to the bottom of what really happened, but the woman adds he has now discovered a lot about fake interviewing - sending someone  to pretend to be you at an interview. Commenting on the situation, the manager that runs the website added that theyaposd found the whole story highly erting and they agreed that interview fraud was indeed a real thing and had increased recently due to virtual interviewing.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news mcdonalds-fans-say-chicken-big-"McDonalds UK launch the new Chicken Big MacByJulia Banim:,  Feb |commentsThe McDonaldaposs Chicken Big Mac Burger has finally landed in the UK, and itaposs fair to say that it has some pretty big buns to fill.The classic Big Mac has been a staple of the Maccies menu since , with those two iconic beef patties seeing loyal customers through countless hangovers, Friday nights in, and bad days at work. Itaposs therefore somewhat unsurprising that, after breathless anticipation leading up to the launch, McDonaldaposs fans have been sharing their thoughts about the Chicken Big Mac Burger and whether or not it could ever live up to the instantly recognisable flavours of the OG.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Many reviews have so far been pretty positive, with ious happy customers hailing it in turn as a triumph,a banger, and the best thing since sliced bread. One particularly enamoured Instagram user wrote: I’ve been waiting for this day for so long that when my boyfriend suggested having the new Chicken Big Mac for dinner, of course, I wasn’t going to say no, It’s a solid   for me. It tastes incredible and needed to become a permanent addition to the menu.However, some have noted that itaposs quite a messy burger, with one person tweeting: chicken big mac is v delicious. but the chicken burgers are not the right shape for that stack. Absolute chaos eating it. All layers sliding. Another gave the gloried mayo chicken meal a so-so   ranking, remarking that their initial hesitations of the meal being a little dry do still stand, with the burger needing something extra to give it flavour and moisture. In a bid to combat said dryness - and in a move which could well help those grappling with the aforementioned sliding layers - one TikToker has advised their followers to dash the dry top bun, emphasising no one needs that in their lives. In a video that has since been viewed more than .K times at the time of writing, TikTok user Laura Crawford could be seen removing the seeded top bun before flipping the middle bun on top.Laura has declared the hack to be the best way to eat the Chicken Big Mac, and plenty of her followers are certainly interested in giving it a go. One even suggested replacing the top bun with a layer of fries, which may well be a step too far for some Maccies purists. Of course, numerous inevitable comparisons have been made to the beef Big Mac, with one huge fan asserting that ya don’t f*ck about with a classic. Others have argued that Big Mac sauce is much more suited towards beef than chicken, with one tweeting that it overpowers the chicken a bit. Another reflected that the burger would be better with the original McChicken sandwich Mayo in instead of the Big Mac sauce. However, in his recent review, the Mirroraposs Kyle OaposSullivan found that the sauce went very nicely indeed with the burger, writing: Just like any Big Mac, the first thing you taste is that creamy special sauce and it works incredibly well with the chicken. I was concerned about the Chicken Big Mac being too dry but to my surprise, it was moist enough and lashings of sauce were a bonus. Those keen to form their own opinions on the burger everyone is talking about will need to get down to their local drive-thru sharpish, with the temporary item only making a fleeting appearance on the menu up until March . What are your thoughts on the newly launched Chicken Big Mac Burger  Let us know in the comments below. story: Model devastated as date tells her shes getting fat - but she gets her own backAmanda Nicole Martin has more than eight million fans of her modelling work, but that doesnt stop her from feeling insecure when people comment on her appearance Image: Jam Press @the_amanda_nicoleByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsAn Instagram model has shared how sheaposs been left feeling sad and insecure after a potential date cruelly told her she was starting to put on weight.Amanda Nicole Martin, from Las Vegas in the United States, regularly takes to Instagram to show off her curves to her . million followers.However, the body-positive -year-old has recently taken a knock to her self-esteem after receiving cruel messages from her crush, who offered to help her slim back up. In a viral post online, which has since been liked more than , times, Amanda explained: I sent these pics to my crush today and he told me Iaposm getting fat. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. His messagesmade me feel sad and a little insecure. Like maybe that’s why not a lot of guys actually try and shoot their shot at me – maybe Iaposm too thicc. I told him that for anyone to say something like that to me, that they probably weren’t my type. My type is the supportive type that will gas me up just like I would build my king up always. I have spoke with him since and he has apologised. He said he didn’t mean it in a mean way. In the post shared on social media, Amanda could be seen replying to the heartless messages, telling the man: I donapost think I should respond to you right now.  Fortunately for the model, after posting the exchange, she was inundated with messages of support from her followers, who slammed the anonymous manaposs unkind words. Girl you ain’t fat you look amazing you need a man who loves you for all your curves, one follower commented, while another added: You look hotter than ever. Heaposs already fired, a fourth quipped, while a fth suggested: Get a new crush. Insecure men always put gorgeous women down to make themselves feel superior. You’re gorgeous, one follower commented. Another wrote: You look beautul but I’m happy you posted that text cause this is something a lot of women can relate to. I had something similar happen to me. Amanda went on to reveal she has recently struggled with medical problems, which has impacted her body. P.S. before any trolls like to add in to the mix, I have been struggling with medical issues going on like two months now on hellaapos medications and have just been able to get back in the gym, she wrote. I have never claimed to be a aposfitnessapos chick…I am a thiccc bih genetically. personally i love a lil extra squishy tummy and my thicc thighs. title: my employee mad im using
story: My employee is mad Im using the baby name she wants - shes not even pregnantA man has been left questioning what to do after discovering his employee was furious about the name hes chosen to give to his unborn baby as she wants it too Image: Getty ImagesByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments Choosing a baby name is a huge decision - after all, your child is going to be stuck with it for the rest of their lives. Some parents know instinctively what their baby should be called as soon as theyaposre born, others have had their list of names planned since childhood, and some can even take several weeks getting to know their offspring before coming up with a name.In some instances, baby names can lead to fall outs, especially when someone has had their heart set on a name for their whole le and then someone  comes in and beats them to it. One man has inadvertently found himself in that situation exactly, after it was revealed that one of his employees had wanted to call her child with the same name he and his we had chosen for their unborn baby. Taking to a website called Ask A Manager, the man explained that his employee has been huffy with him ever since learning what he plans to call his child, despite the fact he had no idea she even wanted it. My we is  weeks pregnant with our first child. We just made her pregnancy public to everyone. I manage a staff of nine, he wrote.One of them is upset because she heard me answer another staff member’s question about whether or not we have chosen a name. We have chosen a name which can be given to either a boy or a girl and has signicance to both our families. He went on to say that his staff member is upset because she too wants to use the name when she has kids, however sheaposs not currently pregnant, nor does she have any immediate plans to have children. Evenshe was pregnant, I don’t see why us using the name means she can’t, he added. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Ever since she heard me answer the question, she has been cold and huffy towards me. She won’t talk to me unless she has no other choice, and some of my other staff came to me because she is telling everyone who works here what a bad boss I am. However, he doesnapost feel like thereaposs anything he can do about the situation given that she is still doing all of her work to a high standard, while being professional and warm towards clients. The name won’t change so I’m not sure how to address this with my staff member, he concluded. Many others on the website responded to the manaposs concerns, with the majority seeming to agree that there was nothing to do, and she would simply have to get on with it. People are just super-weird about the name-sharing thing these days. Nobody’s going to care that baby Aidan shares a name with his momaposs bossapos kid. How often would it even come up  one commented. I miss the days when there were five Jenners, three Chrises and two Matts in every classroom AND WE LIKED IT. Another added: I absolutely do not believe that someone with this outlandish and irrational of a mindset is ing in a perfectly normal, productive, collaborative manner in every other aspect of her work. She is reaching so hard to create drama over literally nothing. That level of aggressive imaginary victimhood has got to be spilling out all over the place.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news woman-sick-cars-parking-across-"Woman exasperated by people blocking her drivewayByZahna Eklund:,  Feb |comments Thereaposs not much in le thataposs more annoying than drivers who inconvenience us.Whether itaposs overtaking when they shouldnapost, getting obnoxiously close to your car because they think youaposre not driving fast enough, or parking in the most bizarre of positions - there are a lot of things to get road rage over when it comes to being a motorist.But one woman has been left particularly infuriated by the drivers in her neighbourhood before sheaposs even managed to get out on the road herself because they keep parking on the dropped kerb outside her house and blocking her driveway. Sibongile Mude frequently takes to TikTok on her account, @sibs, to share videos from her bedroom window of the cars in question, and has even taken to sticking angry notes to their windows and windscreen in an attempt to dissuade the drivers from parking there again.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. In one clip, Sibongile showed off the note she writes up, which read: Your parking is NOT okay. You have blocked in my car - in my driveway! I am now stuck!! While another message written by the stressed homeowner read: You have parked in front of my driveway. I need to park MY CAR. Sibongile and her friends have even confronted some of the drivers who happen toto their vehicle while the woman is filming, with one woman caught on camera telling them her parking was not a big deal. Explaining what the woman had said, Sibongile wrote in the comments of one video: Whataposs said ... aposYouaposre blocking my carapos and she said, aposItaposs not much of a big dealapos and then she told her, to do one ... plus other words l can not say.  Sibongile even shared one video which showed three dferent cars parked across the exit to her driveway on three separate days, and explained that some of them are there for hours. She wrote in the comments: Itaposs annoying because you guys only see  seconds, but some of these guys park for  to  hours, and we need in and out of our driveway quite often. Commenters on the womanaposs videos have come up with a iety of solutions to her problem, including asking the council to paint lines on the road in front of her driveway or placing cones down to deter people from parking. One person said: You might have to cover some or all the cost but I’m sure the local council can authorise white lines to help people realise there’s access needed.  While another added: Canapost you put some cones down to stop people parking there  Is it illegal to park across a driveway  Parking across a driveway is only illegalthere is a dropped kerb, but this has nothing to do with the restriction of access to the driveway itself and is in place because dropped kerbs are a no-go for parking. Evena vehicle is only partially covering a dropped kerb, the owner will be committing a driving offence and could be liable to receive a penalty of up to three points and a fine of up to £. However, parking close to a dropped kerb is not illegal, eventhis restricts access to a driveway.According to Confused, police are unlikely to get involved in cases where the parking over the dropped kerb stops you from moving your vehicle into your driveway, butthe parking issue stops you from leaving they may treat it as an anti-social behaviour offence.Anti-social behaviour is defined by the Crime and Disorder Actas: “Acting in a manner that caused or was likely to cause harassment, alarm or distress to one or more persons not of the same household as the defendant.” Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news woman-studying-uk-left-stitches-"American student shares quarantine rule at UK universityByZahna EklundTfany LoVideo News Reporter:,  Feb |commentsFor many people in the UK, thereaposs one thing we do in times of crisis - and thataposs pop the kettle on.Whether youaposre coaching your best friend through a break-up, pulling an all-nighter to get your work done, or just feeling under the weather, thereaposs seemingly nothing that a good brew canapost fix. So when Bateman Solms tested positive for Covid while studying at St Andrews University in Scotland and was forced to stay in her bedroom and not use the communal facilities in her university halls of residence, the first response from staff at the halls was to deliver her a kettle and some teabags so she could make her own tea.Makes sense, right But the move completely baffled TikTok user Bateman, who is originally from the US, as she was left in stitches by the very British response to her crisis - which she only assumed was standard procedure, the Daily Star reports. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.In a video posted on her account, @shark_bateman, she said: Hi Iaposm an American who goes to university in the UK and I currently have Covid.I live in halls at my university so my hall is kind of in charge of bringing me like food and supplies while Iaposm quarantining so that I donapost have to use any of the shared facilities. I emailed them today that my test results were positive and the very first thing that happened - you have to imagine, that this is like the standard procedure - the first thing they do is bring a kettle and tea to my room so that I can make myself tea without using the shared kitchen. They were like, she has Covid – first order of business – this girl needs to be able to make herself tea. I love that. Batemanaposs video has more than . million views, and many commenters insisted the kind gesture of giving the woman a kettle and teabags wasnapost strange at all and was actually good crisis management. One person said: Every crisis I have ever been a part of, step one is ‘right, shall I put the kettle on.apos And another wrote: Cup of tea makes everything better, hope you feel better soon. While a third commented: As a Brit - I am proud of that. Any crisis can be solved with a brew. Get better soon! Someone  also posted: Well, having a cuppa is critical care here.Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: man who left uncles corpse
story: Man who left uncles corpse in Post Office further charged with shopltingDeclan Haughney, along with another man, took his relative Peadar Doyle from his home to the Post Office to claim his pension on Friday, January Prision officers leading Declan Haughney into Carlow District Court Image: Image By Mick O’Neill..ByPaul Healy:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb  A man accused of deception after he attempted to withdraw his dead uncle’s pension and who left his corpse in to the Post Office has further been charged with shoplting. Declan Haughney, , along with another man, took his relative Peadar Doyle, , from his home to the Post Office in Hoseys, Ireland, on Friday, January . Haughney, of Pollerton Road, Carlow, appeared before a sitting of Carlow District Court on Wednesday and was granted bail, after six days in custody, the Irish Mirror reported. He has been charged with deception, whereby he is alleged to have attempted to withdraw the pension on two occasions. And on Wednesday, appearing before Judge Geraldine Carthy, the court heard that Haughney has now been charged with another alleged offence. He is charged with the alleged theft of groceries from the Raths Londis Plus store on Carlow’s Pollerton Road on January .  The court heard that Haughney made no reply after caution — when he was charged with the alleged offence outside the courtroom at am. The alleged theft occurred five days before Haughney is accused of entering Hosey’s Post Office in Carlow, where he’s alleged to have attempted to withdraw his uncle Peadar’s pension. Peadar was discovered dead at the premises — with his death ruled by a coroner to be from natural causes. Haughney is accused of entering the Post Office at .am where he “dishonestly induced by deception” a member of staff. It is alleged he did so by producing a social welfare card in the name of Peadar Doyle — in an attempt to collect a pension payment of €. He is further accused of the same offence — dishonestly inducing a member of staff at the same premises — at :am. Both charges are contrary to Section  of the Criminal JusticeAct, .  Haughney, who was brought to Carlow District Court in the custody of the Irish Prison Service yesterday, was granted bail, on a number of conditions. Judge Carthy ordered that the accused must obey a curfew of am to pm and that he must sign on three times a week at Carlow Garda station. He must also supply police with a working mobile phone number, and be contactable at all times. The court also heard that Haughney was ordered not to enter the vicinity of or into Hosey’s Post Office or Raths Londis. He must also “be of sober habits” and remain “intoxicant free,” the judge said. Consent was given to bail on condition that the accused enter into a bond of €, supplying a € cash lodgement of which to the court. The court heard the accused was not in a position to pay the amount at that stage, and he was therefore remanded back into custody until his bail can be taken up. Haughney was remanded into custody to appear before the court again later this month.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Post OfficePeadar DoylePensionsCouncil taxEnergy billsCrimeShoplting" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum gives birth baby boy
story: Mum gives birth to baby boy at ,ft on board -hour transatlantic flightCabin crew and passengers helped to deliver the baby boy after the mum went into labour weeks before her due date onboard a United Airlines flight between Accra, Ghana, and Washington, DCThe mum unexpectedly went into labour weeks early onboard the flight Image: msnancy_sc InstagramByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Feb |comments An airline passenger gave birth at , feet during a transatlantic flight. The new mum was not due until the end of the month but suddenly went into labour on Sunday during an -hour United Airlines flight between Accra, Ghana, and Washington, DC.Dr Stephen Ansah-Addo, who was heading home to the US, teamed up with a medically-trained member of the cabin crew and a nurse to deliver the baby boy in business class. But when it came to cutting the umbilical cord the makesht-midwives didnapost have any clamps so used string. The airline said the delivery was uneventful. Paramedics were waiting to take the exhausted mum and her child to a local hospital when the flight landed in Dulles International Airport.  The airline had also arranged for an employee to greet the mum with a balloon and a card that read On behalf of the United team at Washington Dulles, congratulations on your baby boy! Dr Ansah-Addo - who works as a dermatology resident at the University of Michigan - responded to calls from cabin crew for a doctor. He told ABC News: I couldn’t believe it was happening. But I was trying to stay calm. This is someone that really needed help, because there was nobody  there. This is the kind of medicine where you can make a dference in people’s lives. Fellow passenger Nancy Adobea Anane, during an interview on NBC News Now, said: We realised that behind me there was a woman in distress. The pilot mentioned thatthere were medical personnel on board they should come around and give us their assistance because someone needed help. Right behind the business class they converted it into an operation room of some sort and one of them said aposoh, I can see the head!apos They got really, really excited. And then the baby came out and it started crying and we were all elated. The mother was good and she was able to see the baby. It was my first time on United Airlines and trust me it was quite an eventful and beautul experience, she added.  Blogger Zhikay Ikejunior was also onboard and posted photos of the aftermath of the delivery on Twitter.He wrote: A Ghanaian doctor practising in the United States of America was the hero of the day.A United Airlines spokesperson told the Independent: We were especially thrilled to see the plane land with one extra, especially beautul, customer onboard.”The airline has since said that both the mother and the baby boy were doing well. The Mirror has contacted United Airlines for further comment. title: russia launches provocation missions against
story: Exclusive: Russia launches provocation missions against Ukraine soldiers in bid to start warThe commander of Ukraine’s Army Oleksandr Syrskyi told how Ukraine is defending against the growing Russian threat from its eastern flank, where there are , troops, and Belarus to the north, where there are ,Russias President Vladimir Putin has been described as not afraid as appears to be preparing for war Image: Sergei Karpukhin TASSByChris HughesDefence and Security Editor:,  Feb |commentsRussia is launching “provocation and deception” missions against frontline Ukrainian soldiers - trying to bully and entice them into war. Ukraine’s troops are hunkered down in trenches being fired at daily but are under orders to hold the line and not give the Kremlin an excuse to start a war. On Wednesday The Mirror met the commander of Ukraine’s Army Oleksandr Syrskyi, a four-star General, at an air-strip outside Kyiv. He told us how Ukraine was defending against the growing Russian threat from its eastern flank, where there are , Russian troops and Belarus to the north, where there are , including Russian and local forces.  He said: “History shows that they may take any kind of action and carry out any provocation and we are ready for anything. “But we keep up with our ceasefire regime in order to prevent any provocation.” He stressed Ukraine’s forces are being shelled and shot at daily along the -mile trench frontier between his soldiers and pro-Russian separatists backed by Moscow’s regular forces.  General Syrskyi added: “I don’t think an attack from every direction is likely as Russian forces are ided up. They do not have enough troops. “But we are on high alert all of the time. Since  we have been in a state of permanent non-nuclear warfare. “The Ukraine armed forces are conducting covert operations, we are conducting reconnaissance, planning for every scenario.”  The Daily Mirror understands Moscow’s GRU spies have planted misinformation throughout east Ukraine, as they did in Crimea before the  invasion. Russian loyalists have been told “the Nazis are coming” in a ridiculous attack on Europe’s growing links to Ukraine, the suggestion being that the continent is anti-Russian. Spetsnaz special forces are planning “ flag” deception missions against Ukraine - either self-inflicted attacks triggering a retaliation and war or fake news. One likely scenario would be Russian separatists being attacked by covert Spetsnaz units pretending to be Ukrainian. This would spark a response from Moscow and give the needed pretext for an assault on its neighbour, which is massively supported by NATO.  As well as , NLAW anti-tank weapons the UK has supplied Ukraine with  military trainers- but Ukraine wants more. The General added that Ukraine has demanded more help from the UK. He said London has been given a shopping list of weaponry and defence systems, adding that the NLAWs are a great help and saying: “The NLAW is a good deterrent. “We are extremely happy with this support and for any help to deter the Russian Federation. “We are waiting for something  - we have sent a list of armaments and ammunition which we need and I really hope that they will supply this.“I want more and our Ministry of Defence, our government has conducted joint exercises with the British side and we reached several agreements.“This capacity will increase our capacity to fight and to win this war.” The Mirror understands from other sources that the shopping list includes mortar shells, artillery shells, more anti-tank missiles such as Javelin and NLAW, electronic warfare systems which can jam Russian weaponry and communications systems.  Ukraine’s Minister of Culture and Information Oleksandr Tkacheno, also at the airstrip, revealed Russia’s military is trying to disguise where its strengths are. He said: “There has been a lot of misinformation about the military and where it is. “In one area on the other side there were supposed to be thousands of tents but then we discovered that % of them were actually not manned. “They were covered in snow and this means they were empty. “This could affect our understanding of the level of threat and where that threat actually is. “When we are dealing with robber Russians you have to call them out. “Putin is not afraid. It’s important that western leaders take action as he is a typical robber.” In a reference to western sanctions and backing for Ukraine he added: “He needs to see real-time action. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. title: country sports businesses call for support following devastating storms
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles.
