title: truck stuck at tarbert
story: Colin CameronUpdated:   , : pmLikeGoogle +TweetEmailWant to  We value our content, so access to our full site is only available on subscription.Your subscription entitles you to -day-a-week access to our website, plus a full digital copy of that week#s paper to read on your pc mac or mobile device.And there#s more # your subscription includes access to digital archive copies from  onwards.Subscribe NowFerry operator CalMac had more than weather and other much-publicised problems to worry about this week after a lorry became stuck while disembarking at Tarbert.The lorry was heading ashore from the MV Loch Tarbert at around .pm on Tuesday February  when the dficulty occurred.A CalMac spokesperson said: #A lorry got stuck when it lost traction going off the ramp when the vessel arrived in Tarbert, but managed to get off once the tide dropped sufficiently. Neither it nor the vessel was damaged.#The ferry wasn#t delayed because of this, but there were delays due to bad weather.#

title: important-wins-hawick-gala-biggar-melrose
story: THERE were valuable victories for Hawick, Gala, Melrose and Biggar this weekend as live rugby ed to the Borders.And we have a mouth-watering Under- National Shield final between Gala Wanderers and Melrose Wasps to look forward to.Hawick moved into third place in the Premiership with a comprehensive - home victory over Musselburgh. Hawick’s tries came from Stuart Graham , Shawn Muir, Ronan McKean, Glen Welsh and Deaglan Lightfoot with three conversions from Kirk Ford. This result secures the green’s place in the play-offs.Currie Chieftains beat Jed-Forest - with Jed’s points coming from a Mason Cullen try.Selkirk went down - to Glasgow Hawks at Philiphaugh. Their tries came from Callum Anderson and Luke Pettie.In National League One Gala maintained their good form with a - victory over Watsonians in Edinburgh. The Gala tries came from Matt Reid, Marius Tamosaitis, Angus Dun and Rex Jeffrey with conversions from Harris Rutherford and Scott Peffers.Melrose beat Highland - at the Greenyards with their tries coming from captain Richard Ferguson, Gavin Wood , James Brown, Jack Dobie and Donald Crawford. Struan Hutchison added two conversions.Elsewhere Biggar beat Cartha Queen’s Park - away from home and Kelso lost - to league leaders Heriot’s Blues.In National League Two Peebles lost - to Dumfries and in National League Three Berwick beat Ardrossan Accies - away from home.In East League One Duns went down - away to Portobello. In East League Two Hawick Linden lost - at home to North Berwick and in east League Three Earlston lost - at home to Lismore and Gala YM went down - to Edinburgh Northern.In the Reserve East One Selkirk A lost - to Edinburgh Accies and Jed-A beat Hawick Force -.In Reserve East League Two Gala A lost - away to Lasswade, Peebles Reds beat Leith A - in Edinburgh, Melrose Storm beat Linlithgow - and Kelso Sharks hammered Preston Lodge A - in Prestonpans..removeIn the National U Cup semi-finals Hawick Youth drew - with West of Scotland but lost on the yellow card rule.In the National U Shield semi-finals Gala Wanderers beat Dumfries - and Melrose Wasps beat Whitecraigs - to set up a Borders derby final.

title: rick-receives-obe-princess-royal-services-judo
story: GALA judo stalwart Rick Kenney finally received his OBE from The Princess Royal at an investiture held at the Palace of Holyrood House on January .Rick was awarded his OBE in the  Queen’s Birthday Honours List but because of COVID was unable to receive the award at that time.He received his award for Services to Judo having worked tirelessly and passionately for his sport at an international, UK, Scottish and local level. And he has done this for a love of the sport and to try and make a dference for those who take part.He has run judo clubs across Scotland and has been a coach secretary club chair and secretary, referee and general person who gets things done and makes an impact in the areas.Rick, who is president of the Commonwealth Judo Association and vice president of Judo Scotland told the Border : “The day was really well organised, and the officers ensured that Helen and I were at ease and would enjoy the experience.“The chat with Princess Anne was enjoyable and put a smile on my face as she knows about sport. As a former Olympic equestrian athlete who took part in the  Games in Montreal, and as the President of the British Olympic Association she understands the importance of sport and the value of volunteers .“She asked about how judo was coping with the covid challenges and wished myself and our sport continuing success in the years to come.”Even now, in his late s and after  years he is still involved promoting judo at club, Scottish and international level in the sport.

title: application-made-new-selkirk-supermarket
story: SELKIRK could be set to welcome a new supermarket,a planning application is approved by Scottish Borders Council.The now-vacant unit at - High Street, the former site of Sainsbury’s, could be demolished to make way for a new shop.The planning application, from DTM Investments Ltd., would see a new Co-op supermarket take over the premises.The application says: “The existing store size and configuration is not commensurate with the Co-op’s requirements and so it has been determined that a new building is required in order to deliver a suitable, modern and attractive new supermarket to serve customer needs and expectations.:Both directions closed near Borders General Hospital after traffic incident“The new Co-op that is proposed will provide an efficient and attractive trading space which will provide an improved customer experience and enable a wider product range to be offered, and also provide for improved aisle width, number of tills etc and a more practical and efficient back of house storage and staff area.”The former Sainsbury’s building covers two floors – a shopping space on the ground floor, and stock and staff spaces on the first floor – and would replace the current Co-op supermarket in the town which can be found at  High Street.Customer parking and a delivery yard would still be accessible from Chapel Street at the rear of the new building, according to papers.The plan reads: “The existing building is considered to be of utilitarian appearance and not of a design or with materials that are typical of Selkirk Town Centre or the Conservation Area.:Detectives investigating Black Path attack issue description of suspect“The existing building makes, at best, a neutral contribution to the Conservation Area, and so removal of the existing building is not considered to have a detrimental impact.“Conversely, the new proposed Co-op retail store has been carefully designed to be of a style, design and materials that are much more appropriate and sympathetic to the surrounding character and that of the wider Conservation Area, particularly as the building maintains existing building lines, incorporates dormer features and uses stone, render, slate and other appropriate materials, all of colour palette to respect the surrounding built context..remove“The building that is proposed incorporates a more traditional shopfront, including a fascia above the principle shopfront, has pitched roofs throughout and with degrees of pitch consistent with those that prevail in the surrounding area.”No public or consultee comments had been made about this application at the time this newspaper went to press.

title: rachael-hamilton-food-bank-comments-see-borders-msp-criticised
story: A BORDERS MSP has admitted her “phrasing was poor” following backlash over comments made about food bank users.Last week Rachael Hamilton, of the Conservatives, said those using the community facilities are “less well-educated” when it comes to cooking and preparing meals.Following the comments – made during a meeting of the Rural Affairs, Islands and Natural Environment Committee – Alasdair Allan, an SNP MSP, called on Mrs Hamilton to apologise.:Man, , dies in two-car Borders crashHe told The National: “Rachael Hamilton’s comments were utterly disgraceful and an insult to thousands of families across Scotland who do everything they can to put food on the table every day.“People relying on foodbanks often find innovative ways to make meals go further and it is completely inappropriate for a Tory MSP to suggest that families in poverty are ‘less well-educated’ in how to cook and prepare food.”In response, Mrs Hamilton – who represents the Ettrick, Roxburgh and Berwickshire constituency – said that in context her point was “clear”.:Plans submitted for new supermarket in Selkirk“I did not mean to cause any offence,” Mrs Hamilton told the Border . “My phrasing was poor but in the context of the discussion, the point I was making was clear and supported by the representative of the NFU [National Farmers’ Union].“My point was referencing the  out of  responses to the consultation on the Good Food Nation Bill that stated education about food is key to realising the social, economic, environmental, health and well-being benefits that the legislation seeks to achieve.“I want everyone to have access to good local food, which would benefit local suppliers in the Borders.“Learning about cooking and home economics is integral to child and adult education, and should form more of a focus in our schools as we try to reduce high fat, salt and sugar diets going forward.”

title: debut-goal-new-gala-fairydean-rovers-signing
story: MARTIN Scott believes that Gala Fairydean Rovers’ attacking philosophy will suit new signing Scott Cusick’s style and he will be a good addition to the squad.The Glaswegian came off the bench to score the winner against Dalbeattie Star on Saturday but had to be replaced late on after ‘working his socks off.’Scott said: “We just brought Scotty in recently who was available as a free agent. I had actually played with Scotty when he was on loan at Brechin City from Dunfermline, so I knew what he was capable of. I knew he would fit into our philosophy and how we want to play the game.“My intention was to give him - minutes, but he came on early and worked his socks off and got his reward with the goal and then we had to being him back off because his legs had just went at that point.“He probably needs a bit more game time in terms of match fitness and sharpness but when he gets up to full speed, he will be a real asset for us.“We went short-term and this gives him a chance to get back playing and enjoying his football. And it gives us the opportunity to let him see what we are about and come the end of the season we will probably assess that again.“Everyone knows Gala is a great club. I think that little bit of professionalism and trying to do things in the right manner will help bring him on. He came down and trained with us and as soon as he met the chairman and the boys make everyone feel welcome when they come to the club .“There is a real togetherness there so I think it will suit Scotty going forward so it’s up to him what he does from here until the end of the season. I told him that he will get an opportunity to play but he needs to show me that he’s here to contribute.“He has a good pedigree at Dunfermline and Celtic as a kid and he’s got a good attitude but has just lost his way a bit in terms of going on loan to Brechin City when they were in League Two. It was a tough ask to come in and play men’s football when they were just desperate for results. So it probably wasn’t the ideal fit for him. Going forward, coming to us will suit him as he has an eye for a pass and an eye for a goal and is comfortable on both feet. He can go outside or inside and has a bit of pace. He’ll be a really good addition. “

title: coronavirus-technical-issue-sees-no-cases-recorded-borders
story: A TECHNICAL dficulty has meant that there is no coronavirus case update for today .The data, published by the Scottish Government, records the number of positive PCR tests registered in the region daily.Public Health Scotland said: "Due to a technical issue, Public Health Scotland have been unable to provide PCR testing figures on February , ."The data table will be updated in due course.There are  people in hospital in the Borders with recently confirmed cases of coronavirus, according to the figures.

title: borders-role-scottish-government-wind-farm-plans-questioned
story: CONCERNS have been raised that the Borders will take the brunt of the Scottish Government’s “ambitious” plans for onshore wind farms.Elected members met on Thursday to discuss the council’s response to a consultation on the matter sent out from Holyrood.The government is seeking views on proposals for an additional - gigawatts of onshore wind to be installed in Scotland by .On the plans, a Scottish Borders Councilreport states: “The Borders has already made a signicant contribution through the approval and development of wind farms and turbines in the past - years.“However, it is clear there is an expectation that the region will deliver further capacity through repowering and new wind farm site development to contribute to meeting this new objective.“The challenge is that many of the best sites have been developed and there are landscape capacity concerns about larger turbine sizes and developing into previously undeveloped and more sensitive and populated parts of the Borders.”:Man, , dies in two-car Borders crashAt the SBC meeting, Kelso councillor Simon Mountford raised concerns about whether the region could “absorb developments on this scale proposed without causing signicant environmental impact”.The executive member for enhancing the built environment and natural heritage added: “Manynot most of the best sites have already been developed and that’s not including a number of sites that we as a planning authority opposed, but which were subsequently approved.“It needs to be the right development in the right place. The development must not prejudice the Borders’ high quality environment and landscape.”The Conservative councillor also said that communities need to see “tangible, socio-economic benefits” of any development.The Scottish Government sees onshore wind playing a signicant role in the delivery of its net zero and climate change targets for , according to SBC papers..removeScotland currently produces .GW of the UK’s .GW onshore wind capacity, the council report states.:Borders MSP admits her phrasing was poor after food bank comments criticisedIt also has a further .GW “approved, under construction or in planning”.Fellow Kelso councillor Euan Robson, of the Liberal Democrats, described the scale proposed as “unacceptable”.He added that there was “further pressure” on the Borders to deliver the planned capacity due to there not being a national park in the region.On the government consultation, cabinet secretary for net zero, energy and transport Michael Matheson said: “Onshore wind is a cheap and reliable source of electricity generation.“Our net zero commitment presents the perfect opportunity to revisit and reassess our original Onshore Wind Policy Statement, published in .“Onshore wind remains vital to Scotland’s future energy mix, and we will need much more as we continue our progress to meet Scotland’s legally binding net zero target.”

title: high-standard-work-praised-borders-college-lecturers
story: A GRAPHIC design student at Borders College has designed an exciting new Rural Skills logo as part of an in-house project.Graphic Design students at the college were challenged to design a visual identity for the Commercial courses, run as part of the Rural Skills provision.The Rural Skills team were extremely impressed with the amount of work and passion that the students put into their proposals, so the final choice was described as dficult.After much consideration, they selected Signe Goss-Hansenslogo as the winning submission from the seven options.Each year, the design students undertake the Client-Initiated Project where they find a real design job that will be printed applied to a business or organisation.Covid made this year’s project trickier to find a client so the class looked closer to home and, after some consultation, the in-house project was set up.The class worked in teams for the brief as the unit is used to try and emulate a real design studio where collaboration is paramount, so the class worked together initially then split into partnerships. Some fantastic work was produced by all the students involved.Graphic Design Lecturer Tracey Scott commented: "The whole group worked really well on this brief and I think that all the solutions were of a very high standard and all answered the brief.“I was exceptionally pleased with the work created, and it is tough when there is a winner as the other students do feel a sense of loss but that is one reason that everyone learns a lot from this unit. It gives a real insight into what le in the real design world is like, and you have to learn to accept it when your designs arent accepted by a client.”Andrew Johnson, Curriculum Learning Manager for the Rural Skills department, commented: “It has been great to work so closely with the Graphic Design students on this project and this has been a fantastic opportunity for our students to engage with the wider creative sector. The standard of work was excellent so it was hard to pick a winner. Congratulations to Signe Goss-Hansen.”

title: hawick-man-involved-bust-up-former-partner-given-orders
story: A BORDERS man involved in a bust-up with his former partner has been ordered to carry out  hours of unpaid work at Jedburgh Sherf Court.Thirty-seven-year-old Glen Wilcox, of Hawick, pleaded guilty to threatening or abusive behaviour at a house in Silverbuthall Road and also obstructing police.Defence lawyer Ed Hulme told the court his client had been consuming alcohol with his partner an argument developed and "things escalated".Wilcox was given a Community Pay Back Order with the unpaid work to be completed within  months and a two-year Non Harassment Order involving his former partner was also imposed.You might also be interested in:Man, , dies in two-carBorders crashPlans submitted for new supermarketin SelkirkBorders MSP admits her phrasing was poorafter food bank comments criticised

title: royal-mail-make-major-change-stamps
story: Royal Mail will introduce new "reinvented" stamps after a successful trial of the new designs. A special barcode will be added to the side of the stamp but the Queens headwill still remain a main part of the stamp.The barcode will make it possible to watch videos, messages, and much more information all available on the Royal MailApp. The current non-barcoded stamps will be phased out but will be usable until January  ." alt"Border : The new stamp. " class"editor-image"The new stamp.But customers will be able to swap their old stamps for the new barcoded ones after January . Royal Mail says the barcode will also help to introduce "added security features" and "pave the way for innovative services for our customers".All the barcodes will match the colour of the stamps and will be separated by a fine perforation line. However,the barcode is removed the stamp does become invalid. From March  you can swap all existing stamps for the new barcoded stamp.

title: dates-announced-years-braw-lads-events-galashiels
story: ORGANISERS of this year’s Braw Lads Gathering have announced that the preparations are now well underway with provisional dates selected for many of the events.For the last two years, the live elements of the week were cancelled whilst other activities took place virtually.Whilst accepting that some events may be subject of restrictions, the organisers are confident that the Gathering will take place.All being well, the Declaration Night will take place on  April when the Braw Lad, Braw Lass and Attendants will be announced onto the Burgh Balcony at pm by the President of the Gathering.On Friday  May  the Spurs Ride Out will take place when the Braw Lad, Braw Lass and their attendants meet with the Selkirk Standard Bearer and his Burleymen.Two days later the Threepwood Ride Out which celebrates the relationship between Galashiels and Lauder and dates back to the beginning of the Braw Lads Gathering will take place.The Braw Lad will lead a mounted cavalcade to Threepwood and the Lauder Cornet and his followers join those assembled for the brief ceremony.On  June there will be a Braw Lads Swimming Gala.The Braw Lads Bike Ride is scheduled for  June and the Braw Lads Country Dance is due to take place on  June.The Schoolchildren’s Disco and the Braw Lads Ball are both scheduled for  June.The following daysees the Braw Lads Sports Day at Netherdale then the Kirking of the Braw Lad will take place that night which is a chance to reflect before the week starts in full.The service is typically held the in a place of worship of the Braw Lads choosing and is open to the community to join the congregation.The ride out to Lindean takes place on  June and the following night sees the Braw Lads and Lassies Association Dinner.The Torwoodlee Ride Out is scheduled for  June, the same day as the Fancy Dress competition and Carnaval Dance.The Civic Reception hosted by the President of the Gathering in the Volunteer Hall will take place on  June..removeThe Investiture of the Braw Lad and the Braw Lass which is traditionally held on the Friday night takes place on  July.At this ceremony they both receive their sashes, which will be worn during the next  hours. The Braw Lad receives his sash from the Chair of the Ex-Braw Lads’ and Lasses Association and the Braw Lass receives hers from two Overseas Guests.The Braw Lads Gathering takes place the following day,  July and the March Past of Principals and Roses Ceremony will provide a fitting closure to the day.Braw Lads’ Gathering Principals from previous years are automatically invited to take part in a “March Past” from the foot of Bank Street Brae to the War Memorial.The festivities end with the Final Fling where live music playing into the early hours in a packed Volunteer.

title: aldi-lidl-middle-aisles-available-thursday-february-3

title: natural-beauty-history-borders-inspires-photographers
story: A COLOURFUL image of sheep grazing on the purple heather of The Gypsy Glen in the Tweed Valley has been ranked by VisitScotland as the most popular Scottish Borders social media post of .The photograph by @becky__ received more than , likes when it was shared by the national tourism organisation on its Instagram account, making it the highest performing post of the region last year.An image of Sir Walter Scott’s ancestral home at Abbotsford House near Melrose was ranked second most popular post for the region. The image, which was captured by @flordeescocia and received more than , likes, shows the stunning Baronial property through an open gate from the surrounding landscaped gardens.The third highest performing post was by photographer Martin Donald Smithwho captured an atmospheric image of the dark skies above Smailholm Tower that attracted more than , likes.Between January  and January , VisitScotland’s Instagram reached people over  million times with  user-generated posts. The channel has played an important role in keeping Scotland front of mind and inspiring potential visitors during the global pandemic.VisitScotland launched its global marketing campaign Scotland is Calling last year, aimed specically at overseas visitors who, research suggests, spend longer planning and researching their trips.VisitScotland Regional Leadership Director Paula Ward said: “The wide-open spaces, natural beauty and history of the Scottish Borders are a fantastic source of inspiration for photographers and these images have captured some of the many reasons visitors are drawn to the region.“VisitScotland’s social media channels have played an important role in the last two years in continuing to keep Scotland front of mind and offering inspiration to our global audiences for when they can travel. We know there is pent-up demand for travel and we want to ensure that we inspire potential visitors with what Scotland has to offer and make it their first-choice destination when they can travel..remove“Tourism is a force for good – creating economic and social value in every corner of Scotland and enhancing the wellbeing of everyone who experiences it. Tourism makes Scotland richer, economically and socially, and without it Scotland would be a much poorer place.”Abbotsford Trust Chief Executive Giles Ingram said: “We are thrilled that this stunning shot of Abbotsford was such a popular image in . It gives you a sneak-peak into the glorious walled gardens, with Scott’s “conundrum castle” beyond.“Social media has been invaluable to our charity over the past couple of years, allowing us to bring the experience of Abbotsford to people in their own home. We have been delighted to see visitor numbers begin to recover in  and look forward to welcoming more visitors to Abbotsford as we celebrate the th anniversary of Sir Walter Scott throughout .”

title: eco-group-launches-new-borders-food-project
story: A NEW environmentally friendly food project has been set up in the Borders with the aim of encouraging people to grow their own food.Gardens for the Future is a project created by Greener Melrose, a group working towards a sustainable future in the Borders.The project was launched at the group’s flagship site at Drygrange, near Leaderfoot.Chair of Greener Melrose Donald McPhillimy said: “We start by putting our new leaflet through the letter boxes of a whole neighbourhood. This invites householders to consider growing more fresh nutritious food in their own gardens.“If they are interested, they contact us at greenermelrose@live“We then form a group and get them started.”The project aims to create a number of ‘growing circles’ – spaces where people can share their gardening skills, receive training and support, and access free materials and tools to help them on their gardening journey.Donald added: “We realise that people have a few obstacles to getting started but we want to knock them aside by sharing skills, providing training and mutual support, providing free compost, soil and seeds to get started, timber for raised beds, lending tools and so on.“This is the ideal time of year to be setting up vegetable gardens, so we hope lots of people will come forwards.”Greener Melrose has printed , leaflets to be posted in communities which should allow for  growing circles to be formed around the region.The local project has been initially funded by Action Earth and Nature Scot.Greener Melrose is also part of the Scottish Borders Local Food Growing Network – a network convened by Scottish Borders Council and sees groups across the Borders come together to exchange ideas and develop new projects.

title: energy-price-cap-increase-uk-households-pay-1-971-april-ofgem-announcement
story: Ofgemhas announced the new energy bill price cap will rise by  per cent per cent from April.It means energy prices will rise by £ a year for millions of households after regulator Ofgem hiked the price cap on bills to £, or %.The energy regulator is responsible for the energy price capwhich limits how much providers can charge customers on their energy bills.The increase follows a % rise in October and will take effect from April. The price cap applies to around  million British householdswho have chosen to pay for their electricity on the open market rather than under fixed-price deals.The current energy price capis £, and is reviewed twice a year with the next change to begin in October where rates could rise even further.What is the energy price cap Energy regulator Ofgem has created a helpful video explaining exactly what the energy price cap is. Watch it here:🙋A question we often hear is “what is the price cap ”While we dont increase or decrease the price of energy, we calculate the level of the governments #EnergyPriceCapthat applies to default energy tarfs.This may affect you. See how it works📺 https:t.co SyVajogqpic wqpvMDGpl— OfgemJanuary , Rishi Sunak to announce support for UK households amid energy price rise" alt"Border : Rishi Sunak will lead a Downing Street press conference today. " class"editor-image"Rishi Sunak will lead a Downing Street press conference today.Chancellor Rishi Sunakwill announce support to ease the pressure on millions of households facing soaring energy bills.According to the Times, Mr Sunak will commit to giving households in council tax bands A to C rebates funded by Government grants under targeted measures for poorer households.The Treasury did not rule out the move nor did it deny that the Chancellor could announce state-backed loans to give all homes a discount on their energy bills of £.Boris Johnson is under vast pressure to ease the cost-of-living crisis, with his leadership under threat over No  parties, but the new support is unlikely to be enough to prevent energy bills rising signicantly for most people..removeThe Chancellor will address the nation in a major press conference amid the rising cost of energy bills.The Downing Street press conference will begin at pm today and will be televised on all major news channels.

title: coronavirus-borders-records-140-cases-two-days
story: IN the last  hours more than  cases of coronavirus have been recorded in the Borders.The Scottish Government published updated statistics at pm todayfollowing a technical issue facing Public Health Scotland where no coronavirus case figures were reported yesterday .And the data shows that the region has now seen , cases of COVID- since March last year – a rise of  since Tuesday .There are  people in hospital in the Borders with recently confirmed cases of coronavirus, according to the figures – four fewer than yesterday.The total number of cases in Scotland since the pandemic began now stands at ,,.:New food project aims to encourage people to grow own produceAnd last week one coronavirus-related death was recorded in the Borders, according to official figures.Data published at pm on Wednesday, February  by the National Records of Scotlandshows that from January - there was one death recorded in the region where COVID- was listed on the death certicate.There have been  deaths in the region since the pandemic began.Across Scotland there have been , coronavirus-related deaths since March .

title: steve-bruce-appointed-west-brom-manager-18-month-deal
story: West Brom have appointed Steve Bruce as their new manager on an -month contract.The -year-old is back in work having been sacked at Newcastle in October following the club’s takeover and is charged with taking the Baggies back to the Premier League.Bruce has plenty of experience of that, winning promotion from the Championship four times, and has managed in the midlands previously with both Aston Villa and Birmingham.Bruce was not envisaging such a quickto the dugout after an experience at Newcastle that took its toll on him, but he said he could not turn the Hawthorns project down.We are delighted to announce the appointment of Steve Bruce as Manager on an -month contract.Welcome, Steve. 💙🤍— West Bromwich AlbionFebruary , He told the club’s official website: “I am delighted to have the opportunity to manage a club that has such great history and tradition.“It is a club I obviously know well from my time in the midlands, and I am already relishing the challenge of taking it forward.“I did not envisage I wouldto management this quickly, but once I got the phone call from Ron , I knew I could not resist the challenge of getting this club back to where they want to be.“I am coming in with one aim and that is to get Albion to the Premier League.”Bruce will take assistants Stephen Clemence and Steve Agnew with him, as well as his son Alex Bruce in a coaching role, joining James Morrison and Gary Walsh in the club’s backroom staff.Albion’s chief executive officer Ron Gourlay said: “Steve is a highly-respected and experienced manager who has an impressive record of earning promotion to the Premier League.Welcoming our new Manager, Steve Bruce. 💙🤍 pic PaKvezJum— West Bromwich AlbionFebruary , “His excellent man-management skills, tactical nous, and ability to hit the ground running were among the many reasons we decided he was the man to take us forward.“Promotion remains our objective for this season, and we are confident that with Steve leading the club we have given ourselves every chance of achieving that goal.”Bruce will be in charge for the first time when Albion visit another one of his former clubs, Sheffield United, next Wednesday..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Steve Bruce appointed West Brom manager on -month deal

title: efl-feels-middlesbrough-wycombe-claims-football-related-debts-derby
story: The EFL says it disagrees with Derby’s belief that legal claims from Middlesbrough and Wycombe should not be treated as football-related debt.Both clubs are seeking compensation relating to Derby’s breaching of financial rules, but the Rams believe that the governing body should not force them to defend the claims in order to keep its EFL membership.But the EFL has rejected that stance, insisting that Boro and the Chairboys are creditors and should be paid.It said in a statement: “Derby County is seeking to use insolvency legislation to avoid having to defend the claims of Middlesbrough FCand Wycombe Wanderers.EFL statement: Derby County update#EFLhttps:t.co UdhvjEuov— EFL CommunicationsFebruary , “Derby County considers those claims should not be treated as football related debts and that it would be wrong for the EFL to require the club to have to continue to defend the claims as a condition of continuing membership in circumstances where they have been compromised by way of a restructuring plan.“The EFL does not agree with that analysis.“At the request of the administrators, and in line with commitments given at last week’s meeting with local politicians, the EFL has provided a further clear statement to Quantuma of its position on the application of the Insolvency Policy, so as to enable them to apply to the High Court or engage in Arbitration to have that issue determined.“It is now for the administrators to determine how they wish to move this matter forward and we remain willing to expedite any process, as necessary.“The EFL has previously requested mediation between the two clubs and the administrators and is today inviting all relevant and associated parties involved to enter formal collaborative negotiations to actively seek out the compromises and solutions required to ensure that Derby County has a long-term future.”.removevw,vw,px, px"Derby fans protest against the club ownership Meanwhile, one of the groups interested in buying Derby are understood to be getting increasingly frustrated at the apparent lack of progress in resolving the impasse caused by the legal claims.The Binnie family made their bid for the Rams on January  in the knowledge that the claims existed.But the PA news agency understands they are concerned that, as far as they see it, no meaningful movement has occurred since and that Boro and Wycombe’s decision to pursue those actions is driving Derby towards liquidation.For the Binnie’s investment firm, Carlisle Capital, the risk of losing in court – however unlikely that may be – or the cost of settling the claims make the investment in Derby dficult to justy.If other investors take the same view, liquidation of the club starts to look like the only remaining option.Derby were placed into administration by the club’s then owner, Mel Morris, in September last year.The Binnie family’s bid, understood to be in the region of £million, excluded the stadium. Its intention would be to utilise an existing £.million annual commercial lease on the stadium and training ground.On January  it was announced that a deadline for the club’s administrators to provide proof of funding through to the end of the season, which had been set for February , had been extended by one month..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: EFL feels Middlesbrough and Wycombe claims are football-related debts for Derby

title: bafta-boss-wanted-level-playing-field-years-nominations
story: Bafta chair Krishnendu Majumdar has said he wanted to “level the playing field” at the awards nominations this year by shining a “spotlight” on a range of British films.Sci-fi epic Dune, The Power Of The Dog and Belfast lead the nominations for this year’s Bafta film awards.Dune, directed by Denis Villeneuve and based on Frank Herbert’s  novel, featured a star-studded ensemble cast including Timothee Chalamet, Rebecca Ferguson and Oscar Isaac, and received the most nominations overall with , including original score, casting, cinematography and best film.New Zealand director Jane Campion’s dark western, The Power Of The Dog, received eight nominations, among them best director for her, best film, and three nominations across the acting categories.Sir Kenneth Branagh’s semi-autobiographical film Belfast, starring Jude Hill, Jamie Dornan and Caitriona Balfe and which focuses on the Troubles in Northern Ireland, has six nominations, among them best film.Majumdar has said “you couldn’t get three more dferent films” leading the pack of nominations.vw,vw,px, px"Benedict Cumberbatch plays Phil Burbank in The Power Of The Dog Speaking to the PA news agency, he said: “I think that shows a real appetite for dferent types of stories.“I think the key thing we were trying to do as an academy was to make sure our members watched as many films as possible, trying to level the playing field, that dferent films had the opportunity to be seen and therefore the chance to be nominated.“This year we have  dferent movies nominated which is brilliant, Bafta is shining a spotlight on British films, British independent movies and big blockbusters as well.vw,vw,px, px"“You have After Love, Aleem Khan’s British independent movie, with four nominations and then you have something like James Bond: No Time To Die that has five nominations as well..remove“Each year is dferent, I just love the fact there is a range of dferent stories, people want to hear dferent voices.”Co-chair Sara Putt told PA that this year is a “celebration of new talent”.vw,vw,px, px"She added: “ out of the  performance categories are first-time nominees which is really exciting.“To see that journey and progression of new talent is just fabulous. I think it’s opened it up, and that’s what we wanted to do, we wanted to level the playing field.”This year the annual film awards celebrates their th anniversary and will see Australian actress and comedian Rebel Wilson host the ceremony being held at London’s Royal Albert Hall on March .vw,vw,px, px"Majumdar told PA that he is “incredibly excited” to have Wilson take up hosting duties, having “brought the house down and stolen the show” at previous ceremonies.On Thursday, the Bafta film nominations were announced by AJ Odudu and Tom Allen from Bafta’s London headquarters.Benedict Cumberbatch, who stars as gritty rancher Phil in The Power Of The Dog, is nominated in the leading actor category, with his co-stars Jesse Plemons and Kodi Smit-McPhee both nominated in the supporting actor category.vw,vw,px, px"Tom Allen and AJ Odudu announce the nominations for the  EE British Academy Film Awards Other supporting actor nominees include West Side Story’s Mike Faist, Belfast’s Ciaran Hinds, Troy Kotsur for Coda and -year-old Woody Norman for C’mon C’mon, making him this year’s youngest nominee.Hollywood star Will Smith is among the first time nominees in the performance categories this year, with a leading actor nomination for his role in King Richard, in which he stars as the father of tennis champions Serena and Venus Williams.Also nominated in the leading actor category alongside him and Cumberbatch are Mahershala Ali for Swan Song, Adeel Akhtar for Ali  Ava, Leonardo DiCaprio for Don’t Look Up and Stephen Graham for Boiling Point.vw,vw,px, px"Jane Campion, left, and Benedict Cumberbatch on the set of The Power Of The Dog Actress Caitriona Balfe is nominated in the supporting actress category for her role in Belfast, alongside Jessie Buckley for The Lost Daughter, Ariana DeBose for West Side Story, Ann Dowd for Mass, Aunjanue Ellis for King Richard and Ruth Negga for Passing.Nominees in the leading actress category include Lady Gaga for House Of Gucci, Alana Haim for Licorice Pizza, Emilia Jones for Coda, Renate Reinsve for The Worst Person In The World, Joanna Scanlan for After Love and Tessa Thompson for Passing.Elsewhere, Paul Thomas Anderson’s Licorice Pizza, the latest Bond instalment No Time To Die and Steven Spielberg’s West Side Story all have five nominations.The  ceremony, hosted by Dermot O’Leary and Edith Bowman, was a largely virtual ceremony broadcast from the Royal Albert Hall, with only the hosts and presenters appearing in person..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Bafta boss wanted to  ulevel the playing field u in this year us nominations

title: magnet-fisherman-hoists-dozens-small-explosive-devices-canal
story: A magnet fisherman has described the “gut-wrenching” moment he pulled  track explosives out of a canal in Northampton.Track explosives are, according to the Rail Safety and Standards Board , small explosives that can be placed on the surface of train tracks and, when run over by trains, cause a loud bang and alert the driver to a hazard ahead.Dave Jordan, a -year-old small business owner from Northampton, was magnet fishing on the Grand Union Canal, Northampton, when he retrieved the  explosives.vw,vw,px, px"A bag carrying the explosives that Mr Jordan hoisted out of the canal He said the explosives were each “roughly the size of a watch face”, adding that he did not know how they ended up in the canal.Mr Jordan told the PA news agency that the explosives were “safer out than they are in” the canal.“It’s exciting, but it’s very gut-wrenching as well”, he said after locating the objects.vw,vw,px, px"Mr Jordan said he began magnet fishing eight years ago While this was not the first time he had found explosives while magnet fishing, Mr Jordan said it was the most he had ever found.“When we get explosives, when we’re doing what we’re doing, it’s a bit of a ‘oh no, not again’. Because we have to call the police. We have to pack up our magnets. We have to move on,” he said.A British Army bomb disposal team conducted a “controlled explosion” of the objects, a statement from Northamptonshire Police said.Police said they were called at .am on Thursday “following reports that a man magnet fishing had pulled up a number of track explosives”.“Officers from the EOD attended and at about .pm, a controlled explosion was carried out”, the statement added.A bit of information in case members of the public heard some loud noises in the Far Cotton area of Northampton about ten minutes ago….— Northants PoliceFebruary , Mr Jordan said he began magnet fishing about eight years ago after he watched a documentary about mudlarking. He recently began uploading footage of his finds to his YouTube channel, where his videos have received thousands of views..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Magnet fisherman hoists dozens of small explosive devices from canal

title: pmqs-today-watch-live-stream-following-sue-gray-report
story: Boris Johnson will face Prime Minister’s Questions today following the release of the Sue Gray report earlier this week.Sue Gray foundthat “at least some of the gatherings” she investigated represent “a serious failure to observe not just the high standards expected of those working at the heart of Government but also of the standards expected of the entire British population at the time.The final line of the report reads: “There is signicant learning to be drawn from these events which must be addressed immediately across Government. This does not need to wait for the police investigations to be concluded.”Johnson addressed the Commons on Mondaywhere he faced further calls to resign.He told the Commons: “Firstly, I want to say sorry – and I’m sorry for the things we simply didn’t get right and also sorry for the way this matter has been handled.“It’s no use saying this or that was within the rules and it’s no use saying people were working hard. This pandemic was hard for everyone.”He faced shouts of “resign” from Opposition MPs as he told the Commons: “We asked people across this country to make the most extraordinary sacrices – not to meet loved ones, not to visit relatives before they died, and I understand the anger that people feel.“But it isn’t enough to say sorry. This is a moment when we must look at ourselves in the mirror and we must learn.“While the politan Police must yet complete their investigation, and that means there are no details of specic events in Sue Gray’s report, I of course accept Sue Gray’s general findings in full, and above all her recommendation that we must learn from these events and act now.”Nicola Sturgeon says Johnson has “misled the House of Commons”Addressing parliament on Tuesday, Sturgeon asserted her belief that Johnson has misled parliament.She said: “I think there is very little public trust remaining in the integrity and the decision making of the Prime Minister and his government in these matters.”.remove📣 @NicolaSturgeon: "It is now impossible to reach any conclusion other than the Prime Minister has seriously and serially misled the House of Commons."👉🏼 Boris Johnson has broken the rules and lied about it - andTories allow him to continue as PM, theyll all be complicit. pic VyjeYay— The SNPFebruary , “I think it is now also impossible to reach any other conclusion than the Prime Minister has seriously and serially misled the House of Commons,” she continued.How to watch PMQs in ScotlandYou can live stream the questions faced by the Prime Minister on several channels.PMQs will begin at the normal time of pm.BBC Parliament will be streaming PMQs via BBC iPlayer while Sky News will also be providing live coverageon Youtube.You will also be able to watch along at Parliament Live TV which you can access here.

title: martin-lewis-cheaper-switch-heating-off-leave-running
story: MARTIN Lewiss MoneySavingExpert has revealed how to use your central heating. Britain’s cost of living crisis intensied on Thursday as Ofgem announced rise in the maximum price of home energy bills by up to  per cent above current record highs.The energy regulator has announced the new energy bill price cap will rise by  per cent per cent from April.It means energy prices will rise by £ a year for millions of households after regulator Ofgem hiked the price cap on bills to £.Officials across Whitehall have been locked in talks with industry bosses for months and the watchdog Ofgem to draw together a set of measures which could cushion households against rocketing energy bills and a cost of living crisis.The idea that its cheaper to leave the heating on low all day is a myth And people will be wondering how to use their central heating in a cost-effective way.According to experts at the Energy Saving Trust, the idea that its cheaper to leave the heating on low all day is a myth.Martin Lewis has stepped in and revealed exactly how to use your central heating to get the best value out of it."Having the heating on only when you need it is, in the long run, the best way to save energy, and therefore money," his MoneySavingExpert website explains."A timers best as your thermostat turns your heating on and off to keep your home at the temperature you set."The key thing to understand here is that its all about the total amount of energy required to heat your home."However, people living in places where its damp might have to turn the central heating on for longer.Martin added: "There are some engineers who argue that keeping the heating on low with all the radiators on and the boiler down can work as it reduces condensation, which when the heating is turned off collects within the walls, and can help conduct heat outside the home - meaning you lose heat more quickly and so will lose heat more quickly and will use more energy as a result."Soyour house is prone to that you may want to think about it.".removeThe Energy Saving Trust saysyoure keeping the heating on all day youre losing energy all day, so its better to heat your home only when you need it.You can also apply for a Cold Weather Payment to help when temperatures fall to freezing, a Warm Home Discount or a Winter Fuel Payment to minimise your bills.Six more ways to cut your heating bill:Shut the blinds and windowsMany people get complacent over the summer months and forget to shut them – go round the house and make sure that no cold air is getting in anywhere.If the sun is shining in the daytime then make sure curtains and blinds are open to let the heat in, but ensure that you shut them in the morning and the evenings to give yourself that extra bit of warmth.Close off unused roomsUnused rooms can be taking in a lot of heat, as well as increasing the amount of cool breeze flowing through your house. By closing them off, you will cut out the draught and also ensure that any heat in your property isn’t escaping into that room.Get draught excludersA big reason why your home may not be retaining heat very well is because of draughts.Allowing cold air to get into the home will bring the overall temperature down.If you can stop these draughts from getting in, it will make a huge dference to the temperature in your home.Get cookingEating hot food will help to warm you up and the process of cooking the food will throw heat out into the kitchen and surrounding areas, meaning your home will warm up as a result.Consider getting rugsIf your house is fully carpeted, then you needn’t worry about this option, as that will help insulate your home.However, you can lose a considerable amount of heat through floorboards or tiles, so putting a rug over the top can make all the dference in your home’s heat retention.Put tin foil behind your radiatorIf on the occasion you do have the heating on, which you should because it is good for home’s condition, then you should put foil behind your radiators to make sure the heat is forced into the room, rather than getting lost in the wall.

title: minato-sushi-cheese-lady-boost-haddington-town-centre
story: The Cheese Lady on Haddington High Street is moving into the former butcher premises of Colin D Peat on neighbouring Court Street.The move from High Street has opened the door for Minato Sushi to bring the Japanese delicacy to the town centre.The changing face of the town centre was welcomed by councillors Tom Trotter and John McMillan, with the new businesses set to open this summer.Jen Kerr, of Minato Sushi, stressed there was still plenty of work ahead at the business before the doors opened.The -year-old, of Port Seton, who will run the business with her boyfriend Tom Cuddy, described it as “a real dream come true”.She said: “We are really excited. It is quite a big town centre in East Lothian and has quite a erse mix of businesses there already. It seems nice and some people have been coming up and chatting to me and other shop owners have been quite friendly.”Meanwhile, Svetlana Kukharchuk – The Cheese Lady – has ambitious plans for the former butchers having found a home for her business in the town nearly four years ago.She said: “We needed more space and wanted to expand so we can offer more space to our customers to shop more conveniently.“We want to mature our own cheeses and we are going to have a maturation room.“Also, I’m hoping to offer a few tables, which still needs to be confirmed with the council, where people can sit down and order a flight of cheese and a glass of wine.”Svetlana, who previously had a business in St Andrews, moved to East Lothian in November  and opened her High Street shop.The business has proven a popular addition to the town centre, offering cheeses from throughout Europe, including Italy, France, Spain, Switzerland and Norway.Mr Trotter was pleased with the announcement regarding the two businesses.He said: “Whoever thought a cheese shop in Haddington that, after this time, needed bigger premises  That’s fantastic.“And it is incredible we are getting a sushi shop.”Fellow ward member Mr McMillan was pleased with the level of interest from people looking to open up businesses in the town.He said: “I think we are in a good place.“When we were growing up, we did not know what sushi was!”

title: youngsters-12-hour-non-stop-relay-boosts-walk-scott-foundation
story: Mary Kidd spent a day running, cycling, skipping and more in aid of the Walk With Scott Foundation.The -hour non-stop relay on May  has collected more than £,, which will go to the Tranent-based charity.Proud mum Karen is secretary of the Walk With Scott Foundation, which was set up by after-dinner speaker Scott Glynn to mark his th birthday.Karen thanked everyone who sponsored her -year-old daughter, who also undertook a fundraiser for the charity last year during lockdown.Karen said: “We are all so very proud of Mary once again, with her amazingly crazy two fundraising events.“Mary has raised a fantastic £, for the Walk with Scott Foundation and I know first-hand how much these funds are going to help others across our communities.”Last year, the primary six pupil at Cockenzie Primary School completed a six-hour TikTok marathon, which raised £, for the Walk With Scott Foundation.: Familys television appearanceThe success of the fundraiser even caught the attention of former Spandau Ballet and EastEnders star Martin Kemp and his son Roman. Mary and Karen were joined by dad Gordon and older sister Abbie on Martin and Roman’s Sunday Best TV show to discuss the success of the event.However, Mary was not content to put her feet up and was once again doing her bit for the good cause.Speaking ahead of the latest fundraiser, Mary said: “This year I want to double the time, and plan to do a -hour non-stop fun relay up and down our Lorimer Lane at the back of my house.“I’m walking, running, skipping, hopping, jumping, scootering, cycling, skating, football dribbling, swing ball, space hopping and, of course, TikTok-ing!”People can still sponsor Mary by going to uk.virginmoneygiving marysfunrelay

title: former-scotland-international-tim-visser-haddington-weekend-rugby-match
story: East Lothian and Haddington Barbarians Vets will welcome Wooden Spoon Vets, coached by Tim Visser.The match, which takes place at the Neilson Park home of Haddington RFC, kicks off at .pm.Entry for the match is free of charge and evening entertainment will be provided as a Burns supper, courtesy of the town’s rugby club. For more information, email rugby@woodenspoon.org.uk

title: pupils-help-boosts-local-charity
story: Rebecca Fenwick, Molly Jones and Rachel Young were declared the winners of the school’s Youth Philanthropy Initiative .The event, which took place in the Tranent secondary school’s library, saw seven good causes represented by youngsters, with a prize of £, to the winners.The money will now go to Growing Matters at Gilmerton House Kitchen Garden, which is based at Gilmerton House, near Athelstaneford.The small charity, run by volunteers, provides opportunities for social and therapeutic gardening within a four-acre walled garden.Restoration and re-purposing of the garden is gradually taking place for the benefit of the local community, with bioersity in mind.Health and wellbeing of all who use the garden is a priority, including the many species which share the space with the volunteers and which pollinate food crops.Lindsay Munro, English teacher at Ross High School, was delighted to see the trio win the four-figure sum after an impressive presentation.She told the Courier she was “absolutely chuffed” for the group and said: “It was just quite a slick presentation overall.“Obviously, they worked really hard to build up a relationship with the charity.“They had gone and visited it and made a montage of pictures that they had taken while they were visiting.“They had made that connection.“They made an effort to go and visit and they were really confident and passionate about what they were doing, the kind of things Growing Matters do and the impact within the community.”Each group of pupils was challenged to research and represent a local grassroots charity.Pupils then had to try to come up with their own creative presentations in a bid to secure the funding.Diana Simcock, from Growing Matters at Gilmerton House Kitchen Garden, thanked the youngsters for their efforts.She said: “We are absolutely delighted and so impressed with what they have done really impressed.“These are young girls who just identied us and we said ‘why are you interested in us ’ and they just liked the idea of what we do.”The charity already has planning permission in place to build a craft workshop.It is estimated the workshop will cost about £,, with the money from the YPI event going towards that cost.Diana added: “Everything we do is as local and sustainable as possible. We are very interested in improving the bioersity of the site, which was a derelict garden.”

title: volunteers-work-upgrade-path-macmerry
story: Path wardens were busy at work on a narrow and muddy path on Core Path .East Lothian Council has been working with communities and landowners to develop path networks.Volunteers widened the path by cutting back the sides and digging ditches to clear water from the path.Due to concerns about the path becoming “churned up”, horse riders are asked to use one side of the path, while walkers should use the other.

title: centuries-old-church-become-three-bed-home
story: The Church of Scotland is exploring the possibility of selling Whittingehame Parish Church.At the same time, East Lothian Council is considering plans that would see the church changed into a home.Under Mr Joseph Radford’s proposals, the pews and the raised floor around the pulpit would be removed.The downstairs of the building would remain open plan with a reception, dining, kitchen and living area.Upstairs would see three bedrooms, including dressing rooms and a study, as well as a WC.The T-shaped church was originally built in  and renovated nearly  years later.A decision on the proposals for the church, which has not been used since it was originally put on the market in , is expected by the middle of March.A spokesperson for the Church of Scotland said: “Following years of very infrequent use, the Kirk Session of Traprain voted to sell Whittingehame Church and it was placed on the market in .“It was sold subject to the approval of a planning application, which is currently under consideration.“Funds from the sale will support the ongoing missional work and outreach activities of the Parish of Traprain.”

title: gullane-flat-become-new-holiday-let
story: Christine Povey has applied for retrospective planning permission for the change of use at the property on Gullane’s Hopetoun Terrace.Documents included within the planning application, which is awaiting approval from East Lothian Council, highlight that no works would be carried out.It reads: “It is to become an Airbnb with anticipated lets of between one and  nights utilised by tourists, golfers and visitors on short breaks to the area.”

title: return-musselburgh-festival-announced
story: Alison Elgin, president of the Honest Touns Association and a past Honest Lass, said she was delighted that the event would take place from Sunday, July , to Saturday, July , , after it had to be cancelled for the past two years because of the coronavirus crisis."We are really pleased that the festival can go ahead and will work closely with East Lothian Council as regards necessary guidance," she said."We will try to keep activities familiar but there might be some changes."The search is also on for this years Honest Lad and Honest Lass to follow in the footsteps of the  Honest Lad Aidan Maguire and Honest Lass Claire Dougal.To register interest, email the secretary at honsecretary.honesttoun@gmail

title: north-berwick-dunbar-beaches-included-instagrammable-places-list
story: A poll conducted by LuxuryHotel analysed hashtag data and theof the beaches to find out which locations had the most ‘hashtags per metre’.Loch Morlich beach in Aviemore topped the list with more than , hashtags over its m .The beach, popular for kayaking, sailing and windsurfing, averaged out at . hashtags per metre.Seaclf Beach, east of North Berwick, was voted third in the poll with , hashtags over its maveraging . hashtags per metre.The private beach is quiet and ideal for water sports and picnicking whilst also being famed for having the smallest harbour in the UK.Whitesands beach, south-east of Dunbar, finished seventh in the list, with . hashtags per metre.The top ten most Instagrammable beaches in Scotland are:. Loch Morlich Beach, Aviemore .. Achmelvich Bay, Lairg .. Seaclf Beach, North Berwick .. Elie Beach, Leven .. Cramond Beach, Edinburgh .. Portobello Beach, Edinburgh .. Whitesands, Dunbar .. Coldingham Bay, Eyemouth .. Camusdarach Beach, Mallaig .. Aberdeen Beach, Aberdeen .

title: a1-set-close-roadworks
story: The works will commence at pm on the Friday and continue until :am the following morning.During these hours traffic will be erted off the A at the Abbotsview Junction via the southbound off slip-road, ing via the southbound on slip-road.Tommy Deans, BEAR Scotland’s network manager for the south east, said: “A carriageway closure is necessary to allow us to repair the carriageway safely, however the ersion is short so we don’t expect these works to cause any signicant delays to traffic.”They added that the works are weather dependent and adverse conditions may result in their postponement.Real time journey information is available from Traffic Scotland on www.trafficscotland.org, twitter at @trafficscotland or the mobile site my.trafficscotland.org

title: east-lothian-council-writes-off-250-000-debt
story: A report into bad debts under £, which had been written off revealed that more than £, of the total was in council tax bills.The report revealed that more than  council tax accounts had been included in the total, as well as more than £, in housing benefit which had been overpaid.The written-off debts also included more than £, in unpaid council house rent and a further £, in owed business rates.More than £, was written off under sundries according to the annual accounts.A report to councillors recorded that “inidual debts, each under £, in value, which, for a iety of reasons, could not be collected and have been written off by the council”.It said: “A regular assessment of the outstanding debt is made and a list of debt that is not considered collectable is prepared.”

title: confirmation-firm-intention-school-exams-year
story: Craig Hoy, who represents South Scotland, called on the Scottish Government to guarantee that every pupil in the county would be able to sit national school exams this year as planned.Now, the Scottish Government has confirmed that is the intention – unless public health advice says otherwise.Mr Hoy, who also represents the Haddington and Lammermuir ward on East Lothian Council, said: “The SNP must assure every pupil in East Lothian that they will be able to sit their exams this year as planned.“Another year of exam chaos is unthinkable given the uncertainty pupils have endured over the last couple of years.“Our young people, teachers and parents cannot be left in the dark until the end of March.“That is far too late to be making a decision.“Pupils in East Lothian deserve ato a normal school experience, rather than having exams cancelled year after year.”Coronavirus restrictions meant that there were no formal National , Higher or Advanced Higher exams last year or in .Instead, teachers at secondary schools across the country were asked to put forward grades based on in-class assessments.Shirley-Anne Somerville, Scotland’s education secretary, confirmed £ million would be used to support schools and colleges providing targeted exam preparation sessions for students who need it most over the Easter break.She said: “It remains my firm intention that exams will take place as planned – they will only be cancelledpublic health advice says it isn’t safe.“While the number of full and partial school closures has been small, it is clear that many secondary schools have experienced extreme disruption as a result of the Omicron iant – particularly in the first half of January – in relation to both student and teacher absences.“This package of measures is designed to ensure our learners are fully supported in their learning and preparations for the exams this year.”

title: investigation-continues-source-river-esk-pollution
story: The Scottish Environment Protection Agencyis carrying out “a range of investigations and assessments” in relation to the source of the oil-based spillage, which was first reported on January .East Lothian Council said that it had continued to monitor the ious controls and measures which were put in place to contain and mitigate any remaining polluting material.This has included inspections of the booms and renewing these where required.“Supported by our contractor, we are currently assessing what further measures might be required in order to protect the local environment,” said a spokesperson.They added: “While the situation with discoloured water has improved signicantly, local people may still observe some residual polluted material discolouration on the surface of the river and the Craigie Burn, which discharged into the Esk, particularlywe experience signicant rainfall patterns.”Further multi-agency meetings are planned to review progress and inform next steps.

title: loch-centre-used-drop-in-coronavirus-vaccination-centre
story: Vaccinations are on offer from .am to pm on Friday at the town’s Loch Centre.Anyone heading to the venue can have a first or second Covid jab, as well as a Covid booster.Twelve to -year-olds must leave  weeks between the first and second doses.For more information, go to www.nhsinform.scot

title: chart-toppers-texas-play-fringe-sea-2022
story: Fringe by the Sea will run for  days in August, featuring a mix of local, national and international talent across music, literature, comedy, science and nature, as well as food and drink from the county’s best street food stalls.Following the success of the Big Top in the Lodge Grounds last year, that venue will now be the main hub of the festival, with other locations around the town, such as the Marine Hotel and the Scottish Seabird Centre, also hosting events.Fringe by the Sea has confirmed that Texas will perform at the Big Top on August , with tickets available for purchase from am this morning .The band, formed in  by singer Sharleen Spiteri and bassist Johnny McElhone, took the world by storm with their debut single I Don’t Want A Lover, which became a global hit in .With more than  million albums sold to date, the band’s repertoire includes a raft of hits including Black Eyed Boy, Say What You Want and Summer Son.The announcement comes as Candi Staton, who has been billed for the past two years but unable to attend due to Covid- restrictions, confirms she will appear at Fringe by the Sea on August .In support of Scotland’s Year of Stories, Fringe by the Sea will also welcome its first storyteller-in-residence, writer and facilitator Lorna Hill.Lorna lives near Dunbar and has worked with organisations including Dunbar Dementia Network, East Lothian day centres, Headway East Lothian, Women’s Aid East and Midlothian, and Capital Theatres.She is currently an Artist in Residence with Luminate and Erskine Care Homes and a project facilitator for Bringing Out Leaders in Dementia, a joint initiative between Edinburgh and Queen Margaret Universities.Last year, the festival brought £,, of economic benefit to East Lothian, according to an independent report by MKA Economics. This represents a doublingof the  figure .More than , people visited the festival in , with , purchasing tickets to one of  events and an estimated , attending free events throughout the town.In , visitors totalled ,, with  per cent rating the festival either excellent or very good, and  per cent saying they would ‘definitely’ attend in the future.Rory Steel, festival director, said: “Last year, Fringe by the Sea delivered a huge boost to North Berwick – residents and visitors came out in droves to enjoy the acts and events.“As ever, we strive to produce a wide-reaching programme that will provide entertainment and information for the whole family.”John McMillan, Provost of East Lothian, said: “It was wonderful to welcome back Fringe by the Sea in , to see the impressive programme of events and of course to see people enjoying themselves!“I have no doubt that the  event will be another resounding success and help to cement the festival’s position on the national events calendar. The boost it brings to North Berwick, to East Lothian and to local businesses is enormous. East Lothian Council will once again work with the organisers to ensure a safe and happy, fantastic time for all to enjoy at Fringe by the Sea .”For more information on this year’s August - events, visit fringebythesea
